item.title: Borderlands 4 Reveals First DLC Vault Hunter C4SH
item.description:
Gearbox Software has officially introduced C4SH, the first DLC Vault Hunter coming to Borderlands 4 early next year. The first new entry in the series in six years has plenty to offer players right out the gate, but Gearbox already has more in store for Borderlands 4 players in the near future, including expansions to the character roster.

In classic Borderlands fashion, there are four unique characters to choose from in Borderlands 4 's base game, each with their own unique skills and playstyles. The current selection of Vault Hunters has proven to be a hit with fans for their versatility and buildcraft potential, but Gearbox isn’t stopping there, as the studio has confirmed that two more playable characters will be added to the game as paid DLC throughout 2026.

Borderlands 4 Shows Off New Vault Hunter C4SH

As teased earlier this week, Gearbox lifted the veil off Borderlands 4 ’s first DLC character at the Tokyo Game Show. Slated to arrive in Q1 2026, C4SH is a robot that once worked as a casino dealer before switching trades and becoming a Vault Hunter, which is reflected in the dice and playing cards included in his kit. According to Randy Pitchford, C4SH will have powers based on random chance, though how exactly that will translate to gameplay remains to be seen. It also remains to be seen when information regarding Borderlands 4 ’s second DLC character will be revealed.

C4SH will be available to players who own Borderlands 4 ’s Super Deluxe Edition or Vault Hunter Pack. He will also be included in the game’s first Story Pack, Mad Ellie and the Vault of the Damned . Set in a new region of Kairos, it will provide players with new campaign missions and side quests to take on, as well as new gear and cosmetics to earn. With both C4SH and Mad Ellie and the Vault of the Damned slated to launch in Q1 2026, fans hopefully won’t have to wait too long to find out when exactly the new character and story expansions will be added to the game.

That’s not to say that players won’t have anything new to look forward to before then. According to the game’s post-launch roadmap, Borderlands 4 is set to receive plenty of additional content throughout the last quarter of 2025. In addition to the first of four paid Bounty Pack DLCs containing new missions, bosses, and more, players will also be treated to free content such as a seasonal event called Horrors of Kairos, new legendary weapons and cosmetics, and an additional Ultimate Vault Hunter mode level.

22
7.9 /10
8 /10

item.title: Best Balatro Seeds To Try
item.description:
Once players have got the hang of vanilla Balatro , playing with seeds can be an interesting way to add another dimension to the game. While mods can be a great addition to the chaos, the built-in seed mechanic can provide more than enough additional content for players to enjoy, ranging from absurd challenge runs to overpowered deck combinations.

The number of possible seeds means that those who stumble across a particularly interesting deck may share the seed with others to see how they might approach it differently or to allow others to bask in the insanity that some of the seeds provide. With so many possible combinations out there, more crazy seeds are being discovered every day and added to the list of madness.

Updated June 28, 2025, by Oliver Tuscarny: As of February 2025, Balatro received its first significant post-launch balance patch, Update 1.0.1f, which notably altered how seeds behave, particularly in the Gold Stake mode. Now, random seeds are generated to guarantee that the first Legendary Joker in that mode hasn’t already been unlocked on Gold Stake, which can significantly shift early-run setups and shared seed outcomes.

Additionally, player reports suggest that seeds created before April 2024 may no longer reliably reproduce the same decks or events following the gameplay overhaul update. If players are experimenting with seeds, especially ones posted before April 2024, it's worth re-checking them in the current version, as certain combinations and synergies may not function anymore.

HSC1L2DX

Double DNA Trouble

Jhinstalock on Reddit identified seed HSC1L2DX as one with a lot of potential, especially as a jumping-off point for a duplication-heavy deck and/or High Card strategy. Players can skip the first two blinds for free shops.

The first free shop has the DNA Joker, which will allow players to duplicate one card every round. In the next shop, players need to make sure they only have the DNA Joker active and open the Spectral pack before claiming anything else. Using the Ankh Card will duplicate the DNA Joker. This was tested on a Blue Base difficulty deck.

8Q47WV6K

Royal Jesters

LEMO2000 on Reddit identified this seed as one that gives two legendary jokers within the first two rounds. Skipping the first round gives the player a tag, which will double the Mega Arcana pack that players will get from skipping the second round. Both of these packs have a Soul Spectral card that will generate a Legendary Joker.

The Legendary Jokers that the player receives may depend on which Legendary Jokers they have unlocked. This was tested on a white stakes blue deck with all Jokers unlocked. The Soul card yielded Triboulet (which gives played Kings and Queen x2 bonus), then Perkeo (which creates negative copies of consumables).

4T1SZKLF

The Elusive Cryptid

SoulsTornado posted a video that demonstrated the stunning potential of the 4T1SZKLF seed. There is an uncommon Joker that can be skipped or played on the first small blind. Pretty normal so far, but there are a couple of tasty Soul cards soon to follow. SoulTornado indicated that they were able to put a Cryptid card in the consumable section and have it multiply over and over again by Perkeo.

This could not be replicated with a blue deck, but other players should be able to discover the key to this seed with a ghost deck and some creative thinking. It has a lot of potential in the hands of an expert Balatro player. It is certainly a strong deck and easily takes the player quite a few antes past the 8th ante win.

XD55DZ57

DNA Splicing Seed

Duplicating cards is a consistent, effective way of toppling high blinds and powering through the later antes. s610 discovered an incredible triple DNA run that allows players to copy powerful cards over and over, so long as they are the first card played.

The user notes that by using the ghost deck and beating the first boss blind, the next shop presented is incredible. Hex can be used on the DNA Joker, and opening the spectral grants the Ahnk, which can then be used to duplicate it once more, and finally, the wraith for an additional copy. There are even further possibilities down the line with Brainstorm and the blueprint being accessible, furthering the potential of this run.

PTSBMSMQ

Double The Mimes, Double The Fun

Arcade_silent posted this seed that gifts the player with a mime and an ankh to copy, all on the first ante. After a few more antes, Yorick is also accessible, which allows players to trigger an absurd in-hand multiplier multiple times with the duo of mimes.

Winning a run with this seed is a cakewalk thanks to the immense buffs presented right from the get-go. In order to afford the ankh, the player must buy the right pack first and sell the rare joker inside. Then, buy the Mime on the left pack and finally buy the ankh. Simple.

LHZYIWR6

The Perfect Blueprint

A double blueprint is the perfect recipe for insanity; credit to TheRealQuasar. Combined with a later baron pick up by as early as ante two, and suddenly the in-hand kings become x10 multipliers and beyond. Later on, players can grab the blueprint's brother brainstorm, allowing for one single joker to be buffed to the nine.

Sometimes it is nice to have a simple, straightforward game plan for developing the deck. In this case, it is as simple as picking a joker to focus on and buffing it as much as possible until deep into the antes.

7LB2WVPK

10 Of Spades Only

Sadira_kelor posted this hilarious challenge run that requires using the erratic deck, which can be acquired by winning a game on the orange stake difficulty. To put it simply, it is absurd. Fighting through the early blinds is hard enough, but when the deck has no variety, no face cards, and just a load of 10s, even ante one looks impossible.

There are a few ways of getting the deck off the ground, and with a couple of modifiers to specific suits like the arrowhead, the run starts to look doable. But whether it is possible to go all the way to ante eight with this silly yet challenging seed is yet to be seen.

ALEEB

Legend After Legend

Few runs are as impressive and absurd as a full set of legendary jokers within the first five or so shops. Each one offers an arcana pack, which nets a new face to add to the lineup and tears open the game in unbelievable ways.

The only caveat is budgeting income and ensuring the player doesn't spend their money too early on to guarantee the arcana purchases and grant an unforgettable run that delivers in every aspect possible. Each one boosts win potential exponentially, and each Joker provides a unique buff that dramatically changes how the game is played.

29ZSW8MY

Hilarious Duplication Right From The Start

MrBulldops5878 shared this seed that offers one of the most broken early-game setups in all of Balatro : Blueprint and Brainstorm. As early as ante two, players are gifted with both Jokers that can easily be picked up with little to no issues. When running the Gold Deck, the Blueprint will be Eternal, but players won't ever want to sell or destroy it anyway due to the sheer power it brings in combination with Brainstorm.

Also available early into the run is the Photograph, which gives a nice stable way of generating points early whilst still giving players a handy option they can bring with them throughout the run. The seed is perfect for players who want a nice, consistent strategy that still has plenty of flexibility to be built how they choose, but the basic combo is enough to carry any method to infinity.

PQNVFI72

Picture-Perfect Plays

User ThatOneWeirdo66 posted this remarkable build that lives up to the name as one of the luckiest seeds out there. It doesn't take long to get the ball rolling, as right from the first buffoon back players are offered either the Photograph or Ancient Joker, both serving as great openers that lead the player into the next few antes.

The third shop is where the real treasure lies, presenting the player with an Arcana pack that reveals the legendary Joker Triboulet, providing a huge bonus to high-scoring cards like Kings and Queens. From there, players can also grab a Cryptid card and apply it to a king to ramp up the synergy, and once the first few tools are in place, things quickly run away, offering a nice, easy ride all the way into the later antes.

item.title: Watcher at the Edge Boss Guide - Silksong
item.description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong features a wide range of endgame secrets and challenges. Some of the best are collectively known as Mementos, which are special items awarded for completing hidden bosses and mini-games. One such item is the Grey Memento, which is awarded for defeating the Watcher at the Edge, a late-game boss that can only be found once you've started Act 3 and collected the Silk Soar ability. In this guide, we'll show you where to find the Watcher at the Edge in Silksong , and how to get the Grey Memento .

Where to FInd the Watcher at the Edge in Silksong

Sands of Karak:

To locate the Watcher at the Edge in Silksong, you'll first need to unlock the Sands of Karak region, then collect the Silk Soar ability in Silksong 's third act, Abyss.

Once you have the Silk Soar ability, you'll want to return to the main corridor leading along the southwest section of the Sands of Karak. There, you'll need to locate the correct seed, and use it to reach a hidden area.

The first seed sends branches to the east and west. You'll want to follow the branch to the west, which will provide a path to the second seed, which is hidden in the ceiling of the cavern.

Hit the second seed, and it will provide a path to the hidden area.

Once you are in the hidden area, head to the edge of the small platform on the left, then use Silk Soar to reach the upper area.

After using Silk Soar, head left (west) until you reach the Watcher at the Edge, who appears to be a statue standing in a sandstorm. Play the Needolin to wake the sleeping boss. This will immediately begin the fight.

How to Defeat the Watcher at the Edge in Silksong

Our Loadout:

  • Crest: Crest o Wanderer Crest
  • Red Tool: Tacks
  • Yellow Tools: Magnetite Dice
  • Blue Tools: Injector Band , Longclaw , Druid's Eyes

For this fight, we prefer an extremely fast attack, so we opted for the Wanderer Crest, which is essentially the Nail from Hollow Knight . We added Longclaw to make up for the shorter blade, Injector Band to heal safely during the fast-paced fight, and Druid's Eyes, so even our mistakes would have benefits (silk accrued on damage taken). Finally, we used Tacks, as the Watcher lunges across the ground, making him extremely vulnerable to this tool.

We'd recommend upgrading the Needle at least three times. The fight is already tough, so there is no need to punish yourself by using a weak weapon. For this same reason, try to enter the fight with at least 8 Masks. Now that you have Silk Soar, there is no reason you can't collect all 20 of SIlksong 's Mask Shards. 8 is simply the lowest we'd recommend.

Watcher at the Edge Fight Breakdown:

The Watcher at the Edge fight is not overly intricate, but they are capable of doing a tremendous amount of damage very quickly, so you've got to pay close attention throughout the fight. Luckily, while they can be staggered, they only have one true phase, and their moveset stays consistent throughout the fight.

  • The first major factor you need to watch for is the sheer length of the Watcher's blade. It is far longer than it appears, and can easily trick you into thinking you have plenty of space, when in fact you do not. Always give yourself more room than you think you'll need to avoid their attacks.
  • The best way to punish the Watcher's massive swings, is to wait for the sword to hit the ground, then pogo attack their head, then go up and over, and quickly attack from behind. Never try for more than two hits, as they will always punish you.
  • Be very careful not to spend too much time in the air, and never jump when the Watcher is in a clear defensive position, like the pose pictured above.
  • The defensive position shown is almost always a precursor to a massive jump attack that will make you pay if you jump into it.
  • You'll also want to watch for the Watcher diving into the sand. When this happens, sand will begin to burst from the area in which the Watcher will emerge. They will perform a massive attack, similar to their jumping attack, so stay clear.
  • Remember - use Tacks or other ground-based tools. This will often be the difference between a successful fight and a failure.

Once you've defeated the Watcher at the Edge, you'll automatically receive the Grey Memento, one of Silksong 's eight Mementos that can be displayed at the Bellhome.

Hollow Knight: Silksong
49
9.0 /10
Released
September 4, 2025

item.title: Best Open-World Multiplayer Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Multiplayer open-world games offer endless hours of fun and community interaction.
  • Monster Hunter Wilds, Forza Horizon 5, and Red Dead Online are standout examples.
  • Collaborating in multiplayer enhances the gameplay experience of survival games like Project Zomboid and Valheim.

Good multiplayer games attract massive fanbases and become legendary when everything clicks. This is especially true in the case of multiplayer open-world games. These titles can be challenging to get right, but that makes it all the more memorable when developers nail them.

Any open-world game with a strong multiplayer component can keep players satisfied for hundreds, if not thousands, of hours. Improving one's skills and interacting with the community never gets old as players make the most of what these games have to offer. Not to mention, sharing a game is always a great way to spend time with friends — and maybe make new ones.

8 Monster Hunter Wilds

Despite Its Issues, Newcomers Will Love This Welcoming Entry

Monster Hunter Wilds
58
8.2 /10
Released
February 28, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence, Blood, Crude Humor
10 Images
Powered by

Monster Hunter Wilds may be getting some flak from long-time fans of the franchise, but Capcom can hopefully fix the game's technical issues and make it easier to play. Regardless, players new to the series can still have a great time with what this title has to offer.

The story-driven gameplay ensures that beginners will have an easy go of things, and it's easy to find like-minded players in the community who will love teaming up to tackle the game's hardest bosses. Players will enjoy the real Monster Hunter experience after the story comes to an end, letting them tackle the game's toughest foes and forge better gear for themselves.

7 Forza Horizon 5

Lets Players Drive Flashy Cars In No Time

Forza Horizon 5
9 /10
27
8.4 /10
Released
November 9, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone // In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
8 Images
Powered by

Forza Horizon 5 is an excellent open-world racing game that lets players explore Mexico and partake in the Horizon Festival here. The beautiful visuals of this game, coupled with its focus on multiplayer, ensure that players will love showing off their cars in the game's many races.

While some people may have issues with unlocking great cars so easily in the game, it's just a part of what makes the game fun. Zooming past other racers in breakneck races and other such driving events never ceases to be engaging.

6 Red Dead Online

Despite A Perceived Lack Of Content, There's Still A Lot To Enjoy

Red Dead Online
8.7 /10
Released
May 14, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
3 Images
Powered by

While fans may not love Rockstar's lack of support when it comes to Red Dead Online , that shouldn't take away from the sheer volume of content this experience has to offer. If nothing else, it gives players an excuse to enjoy more of this amazing world.

From story-driven missions to organic multiplayer chaos, there's no shortage of ways for players to have fun in this incredible open-world game. Role-playing as a Wild West cowboy and making friends during their adventures makes Red Dead Online a blast for fans.

5 Sons Of The Forest

Band Together To Survive Against Relentless Cannibals

Sons of the Forest
8.6 /10
Released
February 22, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Sons of the Forest is a massively improved sequel where the threat of this forest is always palpable. The cannibals that roam the woods can be hard to deal with, although the experience is a little bit easier with friends. Having up to eight people in one session struggling to survive makes for a great time. The game lives up to the multiplayer, terrifying groups of players together in this excellent open-world game.

4 Project Zomboid

With Friends, This Challenging Game Becomes Easier To Manage

Project Zomboid
9.2 /10
Released
November 8, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
7 Images
Powered by

Project Zomboid is one of the best survival video games where players can have a great time. The mechanics are hardcore, which is why collaborating with other players in massive multiplayer sessions will make things easier.

Tackling this game's major challenges in multiplayer makes adds to the magic of this experience. Whether players collaborate or take out other survivors, the memorable gameplay moments that ensue guarantee that Project Zomboid will hold a soft spot in the hearts of many fans.

3 Valheim

One Of The Biggest Survival Games That's A Blast With Friends

Valheim
8.7 /10
Released
February 2, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
r
Powered by

Valheim is poised to make major waves in the survival genre once the 1.0 build rolls out. As things stand at the time of writing, the mechanics are already so impressive that players can easily spend hundreds of hours in this game with their friends.

Trying to seek entry into the gates of Valhalla and proving one's worth as a warrior is a blast in every session. From eating food to tacking bosses, every activity in Valheim is a blast to engage with as players cooperate to survive in a tough, unforgiving world (or an easy one, based on the difficulty they choose).

2 Grand Theft Auto Online

A Mind-Boggling Amount Of Content

Grand Theft Auto Online
59
9.2 /10
Released
October 1, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

It's staggering just how much content is there in Grand Theft Auto Online . This mode became such a massive cash cow for Rockstar that they'e flooded this game with a deluge of updates to keep players coming back for more.

This ended up being a home run strategy, with GTA Online becoming one of the most open-world multiplayer experiences fans can enjoy. Some fans of Rockstar's single-player experiences have gotten tired of the attention this mode gets, but that should take nothing away from how monumental GTA Online has become.

1 Minecraft

An Excellent Multiplayer Experience Propelled By A Massive Fandom

Minecraft
190
9.0 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
6 Images
Powered by

A huge reason why Minecraft is such a blast to play even now is because of its amazing online community. From exploring an accurate recreation of Westeros to taking part in the Hunger Games, there's no shortage of unique game modes to enjoy in this game.

Players can fight the Ender Dragon, build something truly creative, or just mess around with other people in multiplayer. This is why Minecraft has made such a major social impact and remains one of the most popular video games fans can get their hands on, especially to play with friends.

item.title: Hardest Optional Bosses In Games
item.description:
There's a reason why developers choose to reserve the hardest encounters in their games as optional challenges. The progression curve in these games is meant to educate players without frustrating them, something that is thrown out of the window when it comes to these optional boss fights.

Their challenge is simply off the charts, and ensures that players will be pushed to their very limits in a bid to try and overcome the obstacle that lies in their way. As hard as these bosses may be, experts will get a kick out of optimizing their strategy to deal with these hard-as-nails encounters.

Sans

The Genocide Route Features The Game's Hardest Boss By A Country Mile

Undertale
11
9.6 /10
Released
September 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language, Simulated Gambling, Use of Tobacco
Powered by

Sans is one of the most iconic video game characters of all time. He's also the final boss of the Genocide Route, an optional path where the player obliterates everything in their path and becomes the game's biggest villain.

This is a boss that intentionally tries to make players quit their run and not move forward with their Genocide playthrough. This meta-commentary is clever, although fans will find this hard to appreciate as they constantly get smashed to a pulp by Sans over and over again.

The Nameless King

The Hardest Dark Souls 3 Boss Who's As Epic As They Come

Dark Souls 3
8 /10
20
9.4 /10
Released
March 24, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood Violence
Powered by

The Nameless King is one of the most iconic bosses in the Dark Souls trilogy, and the fact that he's optional is quite fascinating. He comes into battle riding on a dragon that is challenging enough to defeat, as is.

However, once players take him on in one-on-one combat, they'll realize just how challenging this foe is. It's normal to die against Gwyn's forgotten son over and over again before players finally edge him out in combat and give him a final death.

Sigrun

The Hardest Challenge In 2018's God Of War

God of War
10 /10
22
9.3 /10
Released
April 20, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

After beating all the other Valkyries, Kratos and Atreus will be able to duke it out against the Valkyrie Queen herself, Sigrun. She's easily the hardest foe in the game by a country mile and will stomp players into the dirt over and over again before they eventually succeed.

She uses the movesets of all the Valkyries that came before her, ensuring that players will find the encounter challenging yet familiar in its own right. After numerous losses, finally getting the W in this fight makes for one of the most cathartic moments in 2018's God of War .

Penance

Arguably The Hardest Final Fantasy Superboss Of All Time (Barring The MMOs)

Final Fantasy 10
25
9.7 /10
Released
December 17, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Mild Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Final Fantasy has a reputation for adding hard-as-nails superbosses in its games that force players to reach new heights to defeat these foes. So, it says a lot when most fans consider Penance to be the hardest boss this franchise has ever integrated in a single-player game.

Dealing with the Dark Aeons is far from straightforward as is, and Penance will ensure that only players with a party full of characters with maxed-out Sphere Grids will be able to take it on. The boss follows a pattern, and players must ensure that one of its arms is down for the count at all times if they don't want to be instantly KO'd.

Dettlaff van der Eretein

A Ridiculously Hard Boss In A Game That Isn't Too Challenging Otherwise

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
56
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

Technically speaking, Blood & Wine is entirely optional, although it's highly recommended for fans who want to enjoy the full Witcher 3 experience. Not only does it let players explore the beautiful world of Toussaint, but it also ups the challenge for players who thought the base game was too easy.

Dettlaff personifies this to a T. This three-phase boss fight is brutal, and Geralt must arrive loaded with potions if he doesn't want to be ground to a pulp. The worst part is that players who die in any one of the three phases must start from the very beginning, forcing them to be nigh-perfect in every phase and minimize the damage they absorb.

Orphan of Kos

The Old Hunters Introduces What Might Just Be The Hardest FromSoftware Boss Of All Time

Bloodborne
23
8.9 /10
Released
March 24, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

FromSoftware is a developer known for crafting some of the hardest boss fights of all time, so it speaks volumes when fans unanimously agree that Orphan of Kos is the hardest one of the lot. This nightmarish foe is no joke and will push players to their very limit.

He's ultra-aggressive, gives very little room to heal, and can summon lightning that covers almost the entire map. Avoiding his attacks is a nightmare, and players will be jumping for joy when they finally manage to best one of gaming's most challenging bosses.

Jo Amon

This Recurring Yakuza Superboss Is No Joke

Yakuza 0
8.5 /10
Released
January 24, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Most people assume that the Yakuza games aren't hard and that they can breeze through the title in no time. This is why Jo Amon is such a legendary optional boss, arriving as the subject of the final substory in every game after players clear all other optional content.

He's a superboss with a ridiculous number of health bars and attacks that can eliminate Kiryu's health bar in a single hit. Along with this, he has other tricks up his sleeve, such as lasers and the ability to fill a player's inventory slots with fake healing items, making him a pain to defeat in every Yakuza game if players are striving for 100% completion.

Galdera

Both Octopath Traveler Games Will Push Players To The Very Limit In This Superboss Encounter

Octopath Traveler 2
8 /10
7.0 /10
Released
February 24, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Rated T for Teen for Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, and Use of Alcohol and Tobacco.
Powered by

Galdera is the superboss of both Octopath Traveler games, who's no joke. Defeating her in the first game was mandatory for players who wanted to see the true ending, which didn't sit right with many.

This isn't the case in Octopath Traveler 2 , where Galdera is totally optional and is even stronger than ever. Her enhanced strength makes up for the added tools in a player's arsenal, and only the most broken party combinations in the game will be able to dish out a beatdown for the ages on this foe.
